Articles.Content: Well, got attacked by someone today and managed to fight back. I think the aggressor's maximum strength is between 4000 and 6000 (3 farms on the former and 2 farms on the latter). I'm waiting for some attack points to bring him down now.

Reporting in from my end: Futuria is growing nicely, I'm now producing steel and plan to start putting some into alliance trade offers once a week. Alliance members can get steel from me at 1/5 market value. I'm also in the process of converting my existing bauxite stores into aluminum; especially important as wind farms require 25 aluminum to build now and I intend to stick with my commitment of green power by employing wind and nuclear only.

As an aside, I'm a little disappointed that the new costs skew things heavily in favor of oil and coal. Looks like the world of Orbis is going to stick with dirty power for a while...

Food production is up as well, and if needed, I can start putting food into the alliance market for free.

I'm manufacturing steel now as well, but as an Asian country I need coal. Anyone with shares of it can lob some my way and I'll send you 5 steel for every 3 coal. 4 if you send iron. Whadya think?
I could supply the iron but I need to make another coal mine.

If you happened to notice why the population decreased, it's because of the effects of pollution (which have been increased due to implementation). Now that the pollution is implemented, people in our alliance will get sick more. So, if you have a big city, try using clean power. But clean power is expensive, however, so we do need a bauxite exporter or aluminum manufactory, and to save up enough money.

Surprised they didn't mention it in that quote. Recycling Centers will reduce the pollution index.
I've actually posted that. Also using recycling center and clean power are two ways to solve the problem.

Well, that explains why disease in Utopolis jumped to over 2%... I'm using wind power exclusively, but with 1 steel and 1 aluminum refinery, that's 18 points right there. 2 more from farms, and 2 points coming from somewhere (not sure where).
Probably not a good idea for me to have two coal power plants and plenty of mines...

At early stages, you may have pollution. Or, build hospitals which reduce disease rate, sometimes to 0.00%. I've switched to having hospitals and there are no disease rate.

War? It is an easy way to get $$$ and we could wreck some competing nations...
well I am not in a state ready for war as I got no barracks ,and I am still recovering from that last war where I got wreaked so bad I basically had to restart with zero infrastructure.

I'm just out of some [censored] wars and finally picked up the economy. Big success, though, as I've managed to beat the attacker back and have that nation rendered economically unstable. But I don't think I will be in a war for a long time, though, since I'm trying to get enough cash to build my second city...

In the mean time, food is my primary export. Also sent the PM through both types of communication. Hope he IS a Kerbal (metaphorically speaking, not literally speaking), otherwise he might need to get kicked out.

If he ends up not being Kerbal, that might make a nice target for our war efforts.

And... food is my main export right now as well, since it seems unlikely I'll be able to produce anything else for quite some time. Perhaps I'm wrong, unless I'm REALLY playing this wrong, but would I be correct in assuming that each infrastructure level generally takes longer to reach than the previous one? I can try to boost commerce all I want, but the cost of building infrastructure seems to increase right along with it.

I'll be selling food on the open market at roughly 100 units per day at whatever price I can get for it. Unless someone in the alliance needs it badly, in which case I'll sell it at a nice discount.
